title.native: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 スターダストクルセイダース エジプト編
title.romaji: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stardust Crusaders - Egypt-hen
title.english: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders - Battle in Egypt

description:
After 30 days of travel across the world, plagued with countless battles, Jotaro and his companions have finally arrived in Egypt! Now only the strongest "Stand" users remain to rebuff our heroes' final march on Cairo: The Nine Egyptian Gods, Dio's most zealous servants. Will the Joestar line fall to the monstrous vampire, or can Jotaro defeat Dio and save his mother's life?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Dai San Bu Kujo Jotaro: Mirai e no Isan

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Poker
tags.description: Centers around the game of poker or its variations.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Cowboys
tags.description: Features Western or Western-inspired cowboys.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

node.description: She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.

__Birthplace:__ Amagasaki City, Hyougo Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Jin Hashimoto is a Japanese vocalist, vocal trainer, chorus singer and member of [Orquesta de la Luz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%AA%E3%83%AB%E3%82%B1%E3%82%B9%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BB%E3%83%87%E3%83%BB%E3%83%A9%E3%83%BB%E3%83%AB%E3%82%B9). He participates in the band [DA PUMP](https://anilist.co/staff/129444/DA-PUMP) as a chorus singer, and in the band [AAA](https://anilist.co/staff/114613/AAA) as a vocal trainer.

__Biography:__
At the age of 22 he participated in the tribute band Earth, Wind & Fire, after this he formed the band BETCHIN' with Akio Tagashi and [Hiroaki "Tommy" Tominaga](https://anilist.co/staff/152601) in 1998. He alongside Akio and Hiroaki released two full albums.

In the year 2000, he made his solo debut with the song "Aozora ni Naru", which appeared in the Kamen Rider Kuuga soundtrack. He additionally performed a series of other songs in the Kuuga soundtrack, as well as reappearing in its successor Kamen Rider Agito and Kamen Rider Hibiki. His performance is one of the influences for Hideyuki Takahashi, who had his success with other theme song performances.

In 2014, he appeared in the anime _[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders](https://anilist.co/anime/20474/JoJo-no-Kimyou-na-Bouken-Stardust-Crusaders/)_, performing the opening theme song titled "Stand Proud", while in 2015 he also participated as a part of the joint unit JO☆STARS (under the stage name JIN), performing the opening theme song titled "JoJo Sono Chi no Kioku: End of the World" in the sequel anime _[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders - Egypt Arc](https://anilist.co/anime/20799/JoJo-no-Kimyou-na-Bouken-Stardust-Crusaders--Egypthen/)_.

[Twitter](https://x.com/bonyari45) Introduction: Hiroaki Tominaga, also known by stage name TOMMY is a Japanese singer, and vocalist for the Japanese rock-band called BLUFF (バンド). TOMMY made his solo debut performing "JoJo ~Sono Chi no Sadame~", which was used as the first opening theme to the anime JoJo's Bizarre Adventure. Biography: TOMMY formed a soul band while studying at Toyo University and began performing at Tokyo live houses in 1986 when he was 22 years old. In New York he won the Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest, which aired on Fuji TV. Three years later after graduating, he formed a funk band. In 1990, the band disbanded and he joined a South Korean band called Be Brothers. He also appeared as a regular reporter in a Japanese TV documentary series called Earth catch me (地球キャッチミー). In 2015, TOMMY, Coda and [JIN (Jin Hashimoto)](https://anilist.co/staff/163410/Jin-Hashimoto) used the pseudonym JO☆STARS to sing JoJo Sono Chi no Kioku ~end of THE WORLD~, the second opening to the anime JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders and the fourth opening to the anime overall. The first album of the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The anthology songs collection features songs sung by TOMMY such as "Fire of Soul", "GO WEST", and "Mirai e no Isan -Jonathan's Ballade-". The JO☆STARS returned as JO☆UNITED among THE DU, batta, Karen Aoki, and Daisuke Hasegawa to sing Great Days -Units Ver.-, featured in the final episode of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable. (Source: JoJo's Bizarre Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taizouzo)

Mostly directs and storyboards nowadays, having more or less retired as an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasufumiSoejima/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/soejima_yasufumi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ys19710313)

A director with past experience in computer graphics. Former CG animator and director at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO). He is currently affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).
